text: Walter John Learning (November 16, 1938 – January 5, 2020) was a Canadian theatre director, playwright and actor. He was known as the founder of Theatre New Brunswick. He was born in Quidi Vidi, Newfoundland. He wrote a play based on the Christmas television special A Gift to Last. Learning died on January 5, 2020 at his home in Fredericton, New Brunswick at the age of 81.Walter Learning, founder of Theatre New Brunswick, has died at 81 ==References== ==Other websites== * Walter Learning at The Canadian Encyclopedia * Walter Learning at the New Brunswick Literary Encyclopedia * Walter Learning directs , Canberra, Australia * * Theatre Museum Canada—Canadian Legends series Category:1938 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Canadian stage actors Category:Canadian playwrights Category:People from Newfoundland and Labrador Category:Writers from New Brunswick
title: Walter Learning
